subject: Be robust on deleting a non-existing sandbox
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 23:02:36.000000000', 'files': ['zun/container/docker/driver.py'], 'message': 'Be robust on deleting a non-existing sandbox

If there is an error on create, the sandbox might not be there.
Then, if users delete the container later, zun will try to delete
an non-existing sandbox container, which raised an unexpected
exception. This commit handles this corner case.

Change-Id: I84dad0f95ed026a2a9c4e87552c0f457fd07ac37
'}]
commit_message:
Be robust on deleting a non-existing sandbox

If there is an error on create, the sandbox might not be there.
Then, if users delete the container later, zun will try to delete
an non-existing sandbox container, which raised an unexpected
exception. This commit handles this corner case.

Change-Id: I84dad0f95ed026a2a9c4e87552c0f457fd07ac37

Implements: blueprint mistral-gnocchi-actions

commit_message:
Support Gnocchi actions in mistral

In the new version of the ceilometer(ocata), Ceilometer API is
deprecated. So when the user uses gnocchi to store the monitoring
data, the operations related to the monitoring data in the
ceilometer action will not take effect. So gnocchi actions are
added.

Change-Id: Ia5dfb9e26861b0ceb993ec3a924bd27d5433c8db
Implements: blueprint mistral-gnocchi-actions

subject: Add tests for the availability of individual backends
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 18:51:18.000000000', 'files': ['test/test_pyeclib_api.py'], 'message': "Add tests for the availability of individual backends

These will either pass if the backend is available, or skip if it isn't.
What we definitely *don't* want is a situation where someone runs tests,
sees all passes with no skips, and assumes they must therefore have all
backends available.

Change-Id: I1d2c691d01f38d5e8f7bc9cf4ec4b9c50ace32b9
"}]
commit_message:
Add tests for the availability of individual backends

These will either pass if the backend is available, or skip if it isn't.
What we definitely *don't* want is a situation where someone runs tests,
sees all passes with no skips, and assumes they must therefore have all
backends available.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-01 18:55:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/utils/fakes.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1634203-netapp-cdot-fix-clone-from-nfs-image-cache-2218fb402783bc20.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/nfs_base.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_nfs_base.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/utils/capabilities.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/utils/test_capabilities.py'], 'message': 'NetApp cDOT driver fails to clone from NFS cache

In some cases, the NetApp cDOT NFS driver fails to clone from an
NFS image cache. Root cause is code that compares extra specs of
the new volume to capability lists that the driver reports to the
scheduler (such as a list of disk types). It fails because a list
is mutable, so not hashable, so the code cannot do set-based
comparison operations against extra specs. The simple fix is to
stop doing set operations on extra specs. Also, update the time
on the image cache file so that our tests can distinguish between
a fast clone from cache and the slower copy-from-Glance fallback.

Change-Id: I1dfacd24d49b11967eeb0c6b8560114d01952d74
Closes-Bug: #1634203
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp cDOT driver fails to clone from NFS cache

In some cases, the NetApp cDOT NFS driver fails to clone from an
NFS image cache. Root cause is code that compares extra specs of
the new volume to capability lists that the driver reports to the
scheduler (such as a list of disk types). It fails because a list
is mutable, so not hashable, so the code cannot do set-based
comparison operations against extra specs. The simple fix is to
stop doing set operations on extra specs. Also, update the time
on the image cache file so that our tests can distinguish between
a fast clone from cache and the slower copy-from-Glance fallback.

Change-Id: I1dfacd24d49b11967eeb0c6b8560114d01952d74
Closes-Bug: #1634203

subject: Make get-occ-config.sh support custom roles
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-01 22:43:53.000000000', 'files': ['deployed-server/README.rst', 'deployed-server/scripts/get-occ-config.sh'], 'message': "Make get-occ-config.sh support custom roles

Updates the get-occ-config.sh script used with the deployed-server
environment to support custom roles. Any custom role name, and a
corresponding set of hosts (ip addresses or hostnames) can now be passed
to the script and it will query for the proper nested stack uuid's and
configure os-collect-config appropriately on the respective nodes.

Change-Id: I8fc39e6d18cd70ff881e2a284234b26261018d67
"}]
commit_message:
Make get-occ-config.sh support custom roles

Updates the get-occ-config.sh script used with the deployed-server
environment to support custom roles. Any custom role name, and a
corresponding set of hosts (ip addresses or hostnames) can now be passed
to the script and it will query for the proper nested stack uuid's and
configure os-collect-config appropriately on the respective nodes.

Change-Id: I8fc39e6d18cd70ff881e2a284234b26261018d67

commit_message:
Add unsupported status to driver listing

Appending "unsupported" to the driver name in the driver listing
for unsupported drivers. The instance variable "_supported" in
BaseVD is changed to class variable "SUPPORTED" so that the supported
status of drivers can be read after loading the driver modules.

Change-Id: I21ca9137a847873f2ec026520daf8b97603d1888

commit_message:
Remove the 'MANIFEST.in'

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I12b6c279dcc6d56d0bd4b48c5d5c3edf33bab5f1

subject: Replace six iteration methods with standard ones
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-01 08:07:21.000000000', 'files': ['murano/common/helpers/token_sanitizer.py', 'murano/engine/system/yaql_functions.py', 'murano/policy/congress_rules.py', 'murano/policy/modify/actions/default_actions.py'], 'message': 'Replace six iteration methods with standard ones

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iterXXX
  to achieve iterators. We can use dict.XXX instead, as it
  will return iterators in PY3 as well.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
  see the link [2].

 [1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
 [2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: If90a56fad941e4bb55da1e9f14a8133983efc027
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six iteration methods with standard ones

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iterXXX
  to achieve iterators. We can use dict.XXX instead, as it
  will return iterators in PY3 as well.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
  see the link [2].

 [1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
 [2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: If90a56fad941e4bb55da1e9f14a8133983efc027

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

b'https://gist.github.com/b669f34345d81576a0fc6e03804f8bdd\n'

Change-Id: I4dd0ed19cc5c8ea6204ca2c15bf9e18eba459193

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-02 06:10:37.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_tempest_plugin/config.py'], 'message': "Keep CONF.baremetal.driver_enabled for Tempest plugin

Below patch remove the baremetal tests and its configuration
from Tempest tree
 - Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85

Which remove the baremetal config options 'driver_enabled'
also from Tempest config but this options is used by other
Tempest plugin like-
- openstack/vmware-nsx
- openstack/networking-fo- rtinet
http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=CONF.baremetal&i=nope&files=&repos=

Patch Iad6e16c28cf2a35cc6bf040f57224d32c085b7bc moved all
baremetal config option to Ironic Tempest plugin but did not
move the 'driver_enabled' config options.

So it break the compatibility bits of config options.

This patch add 'driver_enabled' in Ironic plugin so that once above
projects tempest plugins are fixed we can remove this options.
Note- We have to keep the same value as it was register by tempest.
      So deprecation flag can be added later.

Change-Id: I1ba580bd1f4beb1c5825b29995f10828f1eb1c44
"}]
commit_message:
Keep CONF.baremetal.driver_enabled for Tempest plugin

Below patch remove the baremetal tests and its configuration
from Tempest tree
 - Id518a6d87d0949737cd1c50cb6a83149b85e5f85

Which remove the baremetal config options 'driver_enabled'
also from Tempest config but this options is used by other
Tempest plugin like-
- openstack/vmware-nsx
- openstack/networking-fo- rtinet
http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=CONF.baremetal&i=nope&files=&repos=

Patch Iad6e16c28cf2a35cc6bf040f57224d32c085b7bc moved all
baremetal config option to Ironic Tempest plugin but did not
move the 'driver_enabled' config options.

So it break the compatibility bits of config options.

This patch add 'driver_enabled' in Ironic plugin so that once above
projects tempest plugins are fixed we can remove this options.
Note- We have to keep the same value as it was register by tempest.
      So deprecation flag can be added later.

Change-Id: I1ba580bd1f4beb1c5825b29995f10828f1eb1c44

subject: Optimize Puppet gate jobs layout
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 14:41:19.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Optimize Puppet gate jobs layout

Do not run TripleO CI scenarios in Puppet Gate if we only try to patch
documentation, metadata.json or release notes.

Do not run Puppet OpenStack Integration jobs if we only try to patch the
metadata.json. puppet-lint job will be enough to find an error in this
file.

Change-Id: I781f35bd1c16921f3f04b6f2fc8254d7819f61ca
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize Puppet gate jobs layout

Do not run TripleO CI scenarios in Puppet Gate if we only try to patch
documentation, metadata.json or release notes.

Do not run Puppet OpenStack Integration jobs if we only try to patch the
metadata.json. puppet-lint job will be enough to find an error in this
file.

Change-Id: I781f35bd1c16921f3f04b6f2fc8254d7819f61ca

commit_message:
Add port qos code

This new feature adds the possibility to apply QoS
policies to port and implement to limit the bandwidth
of ingress and egress direction of the port.

The fullstack test for qos feature will be tracked at
bug 1647506

Depends-On: I1e60851fb1e99a3f803e0bf3854653ff107f768f
Co-Authored-By: Hong Hui Xiao <honghui_xiao@yeah.net>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-06 15:09:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: create consoles in an understandable/extensible way

This change refactors the way the consoles of a libvirt guest get
created. This is basically just a reshuffle of code and an extraction
of methods with the goal to make the plethora of conditionals easier
to understand. Also, future enhancements should be easier this way.
For example, the blueprint libvirt-virtlogd (targeted for Ocata) will
have to be integrated in this console creation flow.

During the implementation I noticed that the host caps are *not*
needed for creation. That was an unnecessary special case for s390x
which didn't make any sense as the guest arch is the important piece.
That's the reason I dropped the "caps" parameter of the method
"_create_consoles". That also made it necessary to adjust the unit
tests.

I also took the chance to rename the "guest" parameter, which represents
the domain *configuration object*, to "guest_cfg". This is (almost) used
in every other place in the libvirt driver.

Related blueprint libvirt-virtlogd

Change-Id: I93a4ac78aaf0ac0c0a99a27ef7e145949f706d45
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: create consoles in an understandable/extensible way

This change refactors the way the consoles of a libvirt guest get
created. This is basically just a reshuffle of code and an extraction
of methods with the goal to make the plethora of conditionals easier
to understand. Also, future enhancements should be easier this way.
For example, the blueprint libvirt-virtlogd (targeted for Ocata) will
have to be integrated in this console creation flow.

During the implementation I noticed that the host caps are *not*
needed for creation. That was an unnecessary special case for s390x
which didn't make any sense as the guest arch is the important piece.
That's the reason I dropped the "caps" parameter of the method
"_create_consoles". That also made it necessary to adjust the unit
tests.

I also took the chance to rename the "guest" parameter, which represents
the domain *configuration object*, to "guest_cfg". This is (almost) used
in every other place in the libvirt driver.

Related blueprint libvirt-virtlogd

Change-Id: I93a4ac78aaf0ac0c0a99a27ef7e145949f706d45

commit_message:
Fix home-page and documentation url

1. Old documentation url in README.rst is
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/python-congressclient, but, this is
a bad url, cause python-congressclient does not have a documentation
page currently. So i replace this bad url with README.rst page.

2. The old home-page in setup.cfg is http://www.openstack.org/. But
i really do not think this url is appropriate here.

Change-Id: Ib0a9e3d3dc2a4b7e8a080add0db2580ecbfd4e0d

subject: Fix calico test
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-06 03:25:44.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-neutron-functional.yml', 'tests/test-neutron-dhcp-functional.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tests/neutron-overrides-calico.yml'], 'message': "Fix calico test

Pins calico-felix agent at 1.4.5 because the 2.x tags and master
branch are a currently WIP rewrite of the agent in Go. We will need
to rework the install process for Felix before moving beyond the
1.4 stable tags.

Also set the tempest network settings to accommodate calico's local
network deployment (tempest role defaults are vxlan, and calico
eschews overlay networks.)

Set networking-calico branch to master since it is not versioned
with Openstack release cycles.

Change-Id: Idf4c558d9e2a31f2a22357ac12faaaa291de3a06
"}]
commit_message:
Fix calico test

Pins calico-felix agent at 1.4.5 because the 2.x tags and master
branch are a currently WIP rewrite of the agent in Go. We will need
to rework the install process for Felix before moving beyond the
1.4 stable tags.

Also set the tempest network settings to accommodate calico's local
network deployment (tempest role defaults are vxlan, and calico
eschews overlay networks.)

Set networking-calico branch to master since it is not versioned
with Openstack release cycles.

Change-Id: Idf4c558d9e2a31f2a22357ac12faaaa291de3a06

state.

commit_message:
Support reset the state of consistency groups

The state of cg will be error when volumes to join cg fails.
Add reset-state API to support reset the state of cgs to the right
state.

Change-Id: Ie472f6c311b0b56605c4ea4b139e2c40f0a34813
Implements: bp reset-consistencygroup-state

commit_message:
Update method cfg.set_defaults

Cors has been added set_defaults method, It allows overriding the
configuration defaults, both for runtime execution and for config
generation.So I think we can update old method.

Change-Id: Ic3132e04d9daae5e5803b4790ed824e8f3e2d28d
reference:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/285368/

subject: Fix galera max connections calculation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 14:34:58.000000000', 'files': ['templates/my.cnf.j2', 'templates/mysql_defaults.j2', 'templates/systemd.limits.conf.j2'], 'message': "Fix galera max connections calculation

The max connection calculation uses the number of vcpus reported by ansible
however it's using the wrong value in one portion of the calculation. The
result is that the calculation returns 0 rather than the intended 200 when
there are both x86 and POWER controllers.

Change-Id: I48314a3b701da4df6aaa0c163b14da36a1e70b7f
Closes-Bug: #1647106
(cherry picked from commit 49a010176f93cbc26a0c98341940028769385f8f)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix galera max connections calculation

The max connection calculation uses the number of vcpus reported by ansible
however it's using the wrong value in one portion of the calculation. The
result is that the calculation returns 0 rather than the intended 200 when
there are both x86 and POWER controllers.

Change-Id: I48314a3b701da4df6aaa0c163b14da36a1e70b7f
Closes-Bug: #1647106
(cherry picked from commit 49a010176f93cbc26a0c98341940028769385f8f)

subject: [zmq] Matchmaker redis available time
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-06 12:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/matchmaker/zmq_matchmaker_redis.py'], 'message': '[zmq] Matchmaker redis available time

Use zmq_target_expire rather than zmq_target_update
as it supposed to represent longer period of time so
all services will definitely be updated.

Change-Id: I0b9a1c8cbc7fea9b2c0c543a270dad318d135c1f
'}]
commit_message:
[zmq] Matchmaker redis available time

Use zmq_target_expire rather than zmq_target_update
as it supposed to represent longer period of time so
all services will definitely be updated.

Change-Id: I0b9a1c8cbc7fea9b2c0c543a270dad318d135c1f

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-07 13:37:10.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/webapi-version-history.rst', 'doc/source/dev/releasing.rst'], 'message': 'Add release names & numbers to API version history

This should make it easier to work out when an API change was
introduced and what API microversions are likely to be supported by a
given cloud. Release numbers were determined by reading the release
notes in most cases, and by searching Git history when that failed. I
was unable to determine when the API versions 1.1-1.6 were released, so
have listed them all as simply "Kilo".

Keeping this list up-to-date is (currently?) a manual process; this
patch adds "Update the API version history" to the how-to-release
document as a pre-release task.

Change-Id: I44b29d29e38b0ac1b256c2377ff84db2482b7aa7
'}]
commit_message:
Add release names & numbers to API version history

This should make it easier to work out when an API change was
introduced and what API microversions are likely to be supported by a
given cloud. Release numbers were determined by reading the release
notes in most cases, and by searching Git history when that failed. I
was unable to determine when the API versions 1.1-1.6 were released, so
have listed them all as simply "Kilo".

Keeping this list up-to-date is (currently?) a manual process; this
patch adds "Update the API version history" to the how-to-release
document as a pre-release task.

Change-Id: I44b29d29e38b0ac1b256c2377ff84db2482b7aa7

commit_message:
Remove AdminRequired usage in flavor

'AdminRequired' become useless due to the wrok about removing
DB layer hardcode permission check since
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/160269/

we won't raise this kind of exception so no need to catch them
now.

Change-Id: Iab9c24d39b6b63dcaa4cb2aef750196650ff18f5

commit_message:
API reference documentation

This patch follows on api-ref skeleton [1] and brings the
NFV Orchestration API reference content to the repository.
It is a part of the effort described in [2].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332183
[2] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Migrate#API_Reference_Plan

Change-Id: Ia2d91adb33f10df9073de74eb82cc19be29a3da2

While working with the horizon team to address PCI-DSS
requirements, it was mentioned that we need to have an API to
discover password requirements. This spec proposes a solution to that

commit_message:
Expose password requirements through API

While working with the horizon team to address PCI-DSS
requirements, it was mentioned that we need to have an API to
discover password requirements. This spec proposes a solution to that
problem by allowing password requirements to be exposed via a
protected keystone API.

Change-Id: I75ce7485aef60e23632d74a2250ebf367a383a92

subject: Simplify ipa setup processing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 07:05:39.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/metadata/novajoin/api.pp', 'spec/classes/nova_metadata_novajoin_api_spec.rb'], 'message': "Simplify ipa setup processing

To significantly simplify deployment processing, we can extract
the processing that requires IPA admin credentials and run this
ahead of time.  The only remaining operation on the node then is
to retrieve the nova service user's keytab once the node is enrolled
as an IPA client.

This means that the only credentials that need to be passed to the
node is the OTP used to enroll the node as an IPA client.

Change-Id: I877905446f9a87c423422311e9d11e9cf3f641ee
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify ipa setup processing

To significantly simplify deployment processing, we can extract
the processing that requires IPA admin credentials and run this
ahead of time.  The only remaining operation on the node then is
to retrieve the nova service user's keytab once the node is enrolled
as an IPA client.

This means that the only credentials that need to be passed to the
node is the OTP used to enroll the node as an IPA client.

Change-Id: I877905446f9a87c423422311e9d11e9cf3f641ee

subject: Fix python3 compatibility when HTTP Error are returned
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-02 17:42:51.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'ironicclient/common/http.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-python3-compatibility-993ace45fefcba34.yaml', 'ironicclient/tests/unit/utils.py', 'ironicclient/tests/unit/common/test_http.py'], 'message': "Fix python3 compatibility when HTTP Error are returned

When trying to contact Ironic with a bad token, Forbidden exception
should be raised, in python3 a TypeError is raised due to json
lib being unable do decode a bytes object.

In order to be really python3 compatible, the json lib was replaced
with oslo.serialization module jsontuils since it's the recommended
migration to python3 guide. This is to ensure that data coming from
the requests lib can be read even if it's not string any more but
bytes.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I27540f58e31817d4de604334bc4c62899d82f4cc
Closes-Bug: #1629068
(cherry picked from commit e512550ab7d61b8bdafd50022dfa8b80a8502922)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility when HTTP Error are returned

When trying to contact Ironic with a bad token, Forbidden exception
should be raised, in python3 a TypeError is raised due to json
lib being unable do decode a bytes object.

In order to be really python3 compatible, the json lib was replaced
with oslo.serialization module jsontuils since it's the recommended
migration to python3 guide. This is to ensure that data coming from
the requests lib can be read even if it's not string any more but
bytes.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I27540f58e31817d4de604334bc4c62899d82f4cc
Closes-Bug: #1629068
(cherry picked from commit e512550ab7d61b8bdafd50022dfa8b80a8502922)

commit_message:
Use to_policy_values for policy enforcement

Use the common policy values for all services when enforcing policy
decisions. We add all possibly used policy values to maintain backwards
compatibility.

Change-Id: Ie1d0739ab4dfb0654d8767693dbdba5cd52a30b2
Closes-Bug: #1602081

subject: Fix checksum memory leak
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-06 06:12:45.000000000', 'files': ['test/test_pyeclib_api.py', 'src/c/pyeclib_c/pyeclib_c.c'], 'message': "Fix checksum memory leak

Since we allocate the result buffer in hex_encode_string, we're
responsible for freeing it later.

Why didn't we catch it before? Turns out, our tests didn't
loop enough. I wasn't reliably seeing a test failure at 200k
iterations, but 400k seems to be enough?

Closes-Bug: #1634006

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Related-Change: I678e10008c3c5bc04640f7f19498334d94cb0cd6
Change-Id: I0f6e922ba25ad56142f3d095896b9856a436a81c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix checksum memory leak

Since we allocate the result buffer in hex_encode_string, we're
responsible for freeing it later.

Why didn't we catch it before? Turns out, our tests didn't
loop enough. I wasn't reliably seeing a test failure at 200k
iterations, but 400k seems to be enough?

Closes-Bug: #1634006

Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Related-Change: I678e10008c3c5bc04640f7f19498334d94cb0cd6
Change-Id: I0f6e922ba25ad56142f3d095896b9856a436a81c

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-07 21:38:12.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Update mock variable name in unit tests

In test_agent.py change variable names from 'mocked_' to 'mock_' to
follow convention we use in openstack/ironic.

Change the mock variable names 'wsgi_server_cls' and
'mocked_server_maker' in some of the unit tests to
'mock_make_server'. It is the convention to have 'mock' in the

Not changing the other unit test files at this time.

Change-Id: I844071c928f92778e8ce0bfbdb8fb89fc26ee43b

commit_message:
Update mock variable name in unit tests

In test_agent.py change variable names from 'mocked_' to 'mock_' to
follow convention we use in openstack/ironic.

Change the mock variable names 'wsgi_server_cls' and
'mocked_server_maker' in some of the unit tests to
'mock_make_server'. It is the convention to have 'mock' in the
variable names for mock objects.

Not changing the other unit test files at this time.

Change-Id: I844071c928f92778e8ce0bfbdb8fb89fc26ee43b

commit_message:
tests: avoid starting compute service twice in sriov functional test

SRIOV functional tests that starts two or more guest were able to start
the compute service multiple times with the same hostname, which affected the
correctness of the tests.
This patch will make sure that the compute service is started only once.

Closes-Bug: #1647776
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8556ce068571d8e496e6fba756c1977c1d2c3ca1

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-07 14:47:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py'], 'message': 'tests: generate correct pci addresses for fake pci devices

fakelibvirt library was not generating a correct pci address for
its fake pci devices. PCI slot field would remain constant in all
generated devices.

While this issue would be transparrent for most of the tests,
but test_create_server_with_PF_no_VF would be affected, as it
should lookup VFs by its addresses.

Change-Id: I810b1087229366770f1ea536b67e3b9741a030a8
'}]
commit_message:
tests: generate correct pci addresses for fake pci devices

fakelibvirt library was not generating a correct pci address for
its fake pci devices. PCI slot field would remain constant in all
generated devices.

While this issue would be transparrent for most of the tests,
but test_create_server_with_PF_no_VF would be affected, as it
should lookup VFs by its addresses.

Change-Id: I810b1087229366770f1ea536b67e3b9741a030a8

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: Ia9d09515435618624919ad715ffa3df833a50a7a
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit 28c04297b2751f3d5dea152cadc1469033d7e1c7)

commit_message:
Xenialify Java builds

This is part of the transition to Xenial. This updates monasca and
clouddocs java builds to run on xenial for branches >= newton. Older
branches still run on Trusty.

This does not change the gerrit and jenkins plugin build which continue
on Trusty because that is where we deploy these services.

Change-Id: I778dde7e24d220a892ba045d650920d28bec24d0

commit_message:
Transition Magnum jobs to Xenial

As part of the Trusty to Xenial transition, move Magnum jobs to Xenial
for changes against branches >= newton. Old branches continue to be
tested on Trusty.

This also updates two periodic jobs to run on Xenial instaed of Trusty.
Also cleans up zuul job entries using last match wins fall through
behavior.

Change-Id: I37385dee3d49c2af6c6d3054df126f1894cd94c2

commit_message:
Refactoring config opts for ml2 plugin openvswitch

Refactoring ml2 plugin openvswitch driver configuration options to be
in neutron/conf/plugins/ml2/drivers. This would allow centralization
of all configuration options and provides an easy way to import.

Change-Id: Ie8c6023b2d012eae7ecdb99d5d413956608f4294
Partial-Bug: #1563069

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-28 16:04:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hnas_iscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hitachi/test_hitachi_hnas_iscsi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hnas_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hitachi/test_hitachi_hnas_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/hnas-deprecated-svc-volume-type-77768f27946aadf4.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hitachi/test_hitachi_hnas_nfs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hitachi/hnas_nfs.py'], 'message': 'HNAS: Rename hnas_svcX_volume_type

Hitachi NAS Platform (HNAS) drivers use the configuration option
hnas_svcX_volume_type (X is a number from 0 to 3) to get the name of
the pools configured for the drivers. The name containing
"volume_type" in the end confuses the users because they tend to
relate the option with the volume types created in cinder.
This patch deprecates the name hnas_svcX_volume_type when
configuring the drivers by cinder.conf in favor of
hnas_svcX_pool_name, so it can express more precisely the real
purpose of this option.
This modification applies only for those configuration using
the cinder.conf. The XML configuration options remain the same
since this kind of configuration is deprecated.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4e2f145b1124f5b567585ec831a58ca6c8138aa5
'}]
commit_message:
HNAS: Rename hnas_svcX_volume_type

Hitachi NAS Platform (HNAS) drivers use the configuration option
hnas_svcX_volume_type (X is a number from 0 to 3) to get the name of
the pools configured for the drivers. The name containing
"volume_type" in the end confuses the users because they tend to
relate the option with the volume types created in cinder.
This patch deprecates the name hnas_svcX_volume_type when
configuring the drivers by cinder.conf in favor of
hnas_svcX_pool_name, so it can express more precisely the real
purpose of this option.
This modification applies only for those configuration using
the cinder.conf. The XML configuration options remain the same
since this kind of configuration is deprecated.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I4e2f145b1124f5b567585ec831a58ca6c8138aa5

commit_message:
Huawei: Mark password option as secret

metro_san_password should be flagged as secret=True.

Port xenapi test_xenapi to Python 3

* Use base64 module from oslo.serialization to convert things
  as needed
* Replace filter() with a list-comprehension to get a list on
  Python 3

Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

commit_message:
Narrow the list of ResourceProviders

Given that we want to get a list of ResourceProviders that can support
a request, we need to propose a REST API call having a
request body that would only return those which support that request.

Implements: blueprint resource-providers-get-by-request
Change-Id: Ibd140287e8c96ed4fa22dd9b36c274530770e207

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-11-29 11:59:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'tests-py3.txt', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fake_libvirt_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Port libvirt test_driver to Python 3

* Use binary files, not text files, in fake_libvirt_utils.file_open()
* Use byte strings for XML
* Set disk size to 0 in mocks to avoid fix TypeError on comparison
  on Python 3
* Replace filter() and map() with a list-comprehension to get a list
  on Python 3
* Replace six.moves.range() with range() in driver.py: there is
  a "from six.moves import range" import at top level
* Replace six.iteritems(dict) with dict.items() to cleanup the code.
* Make sure call mox.UnsetStubs at last to make mox work properly on
  Python 3.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Victor Stinner <vstinner@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I568c72c611024d32c35dd0629cc041ca5c5969b8
Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35
'}]
commit_message:
Port libvirt test_driver to Python 3

* Use binary files, not text files, in fake_libvirt_utils.file_open()
* Use byte strings for XML
* Set disk size to 0 in mocks to avoid fix TypeError on comparison
  on Python 3
* Replace filter() and map() with a list-comprehension to get a list
  on Python 3
* Replace six.moves.range() with range() in driver.py: there is
  a "from six.moves import range" import at top level
* Replace six.iteritems(dict) with dict.items() to cleanup the code.
* Make sure call mox.UnsetStubs at last to make mox work properly on
  Python 3.

Co-Authored-By: Davanum Srinivas <davanum@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Victor Stinner <vstinner@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I568c72c611024d32c35dd0629cc041ca5c5969b8
Partially-Implements: blueprint goal-python35

subject: Prefer python3 over python2
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-07 20:00:08.000000000', 'files': ['elements/dib-python/pre-install.d/01-dib-python'], 'message': 'Prefer python3 over python2

In our pkg-map we try to use python3 (for dev packages) if it is
available on that distro. Lets also prefer python3 for dib-python
otherwise we can easily end up in a case where we are installing python3
dev packages but dib-python points at python2.

Change-Id: I10c85c9cb2e60502525f94d2502faaa50e729ae2
'}]
commit_message:
Prefer python3 over python2

In our pkg-map we try to use python3 (for dev packages) if it is
available on that distro. Lets also prefer python3 for dib-python
otherwise we can easily end up in a case where we are installing python3
dev packages but dib-python points at python2.

Change-Id: I10c85c9cb2e60502525f94d2502faaa50e729ae2

commit_message:
Restrict Metadata to Lower Case Keys

Because database backends handle string cases differently, only allow
lowercase metadata keys to avoid conflicts and strange errors.

DocImpact: api-ref for flavor-extra-specs, aggregates, and servers should
indicate a restriction that metadata keys can now only be lowercase. Also check
examples in current Openstack guides to make sure metadata values do not have
upper case characters.

Partially-implements: blueprint lowercase-metadata-keys
Change-Id: If7c8c29e4ba8230c0666f9710c524a2199343bcd

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I8778bd1b609bc5458a250111dc0a0f9b2fb52161
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit 0fc2099d127b3a5d459f5591f4380d110cc92e4c)

commit_message:
Use tempest instead of Tempest-lib

tempest-lib has been deprecated since a year. All
the interfaces available in tempest-lib are now available
in tempest/lib.

This patch make use of tempest/lib instead of tempest-lib.
Also add tempest in test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: I6cb50b68631391f0368e8a2e6133f94c1da52376

revisions:

The kafka functional tests don't use our setup framework but hardcode

The kafka driver is broken and currently try to be loaded with other
driver tests (and break py3 gate job).

This change remove the hardcoded stuff and uses the normal functional

It also creates the tox target for functional tests and use

Change-Id: Ie6af35321905a04b38e549bf7268dd40543d9e3a
"}]
commit_message:
kafka separate unit/functionnal tests

The kafka functional tests don't use our setup framework but hardcode
the kafka url.

The kafka driver is broken and currently try to be loaded with other
driver tests (and break py3 gate job).

This change remove the hardcoded stuff and uses the normal functional
tests setup to check kafka.

This avoids kafka tests to be ran on other driver tests job.

It also creates the tox target for functional tests and use
pifpaf to setup kafka.

As today, the functional test suite doesn't work all.

Change-Id: Ie6af35321905a04b38e549bf7268dd40543d9e3a

commit_message:
Replace Image Create/Delete v2 PUT with REST calls

Also, add tests to show the delete-if-failed-upload logic works.

Also, if we can't find a top-level resource in the json output, just
return the entire dict rather than throwing an exception, due to glance
PUT returning a bare dict.

Change-Id: I48fe434fe027f6a09588cc3aeeada2e83508f129

subject: [Core][Bug] Fix 'task start --abort-on-sla-failure'
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-06 08:58:14.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/engine.py', 'tests/functional/test_cli_task.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_engine.py'], 'message': "[Core][Bug] Fix 'task start --abort-on-sla-failure'

In current implementation --abort-on-sla-failure affects
only currently running workload and allows to run next
subtasks/workloads after sla failure.

* Change status of task to SOFT_ABORTING after sla failure.
  This allows to consume results from pending iterations
  and abort task before running next subtask/workload.

Change-Id: I1498b62fd6929101ff4d45ca78e185f124ab7b89
"}]
commit_message:
[Core][Bug] Fix 'task start --abort-on-sla-failure'

In current implementation --abort-on-sla-failure affects
only currently running workload and allows to run next
subtasks/workloads after sla failure.

* Change status of task to SOFT_ABORTING after sla failure.
  This allows to consume results from pending iterations
  and abort task before running next subtask/workload.

Change-Id: I1498b62fd6929101ff4d45ca78e185f124ab7b89

subject: Create Glance's database if glance-api is enabled
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 14:22:35.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/database/mysql.pp'], 'message': "Create Glance's database if glance-api is enabled

Instead of checking for glance_registry_enabled, we should be checking
for glance_api_enabled. The glance-api v1 depends on the registry, which
means the database will be created but glance-api v2 doesn't which means
that not deploying the registry would result in the glance database not
being created. On the other hand, glance-registry is never deployed
without glance-api

Change-Id: Ief25dafb65f7a043fbb3d16f1d7ef834c9947a93
"}]
commit_message:
Create Glance's database if glance-api is enabled

Instead of checking for glance_registry_enabled, we should be checking
for glance_api_enabled. The glance-api v1 depends on the registry, which
means the database will be created but glance-api v2 doesn't which means
that not deploying the registry would result in the glance database not
being created. On the other hand, glance-registry is never deployed
without glance-api

Change-Id: Ief25dafb65f7a043fbb3d16f1d7ef834c9947a93

subject: Add support for partition image undercloud.qcow2
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-07 17:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Add support for partition image undercloud.qcow2

We are trying out a new method for building the undercloud image
in RDO[1]. This will make it impossible to drift from upstream
content in the overcloud images. However, it means the
undercloud.qcow2 that is produced is no longer a whole disk image.

This change adds support to use an undercloud image that is
created this way by piggybacking on the devmode code that already
supports this.

It would be good to follow this up with some clean-up of the two
use cases to address the similarities in a cleaner fashion.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/4013
Change-Id: I5878ddb9f82684d775f9daa66fea434d58f9609c
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for partition image undercloud.qcow2

We are trying out a new method for building the undercloud image
in RDO[1]. This will make it impossible to drift from upstream
content in the overcloud images. However, it means the
undercloud.qcow2 that is produced is no longer a whole disk image.

This change adds support to use an undercloud image that is
created this way by piggybacking on the devmode code that already
supports this.

It would be good to follow this up with some clean-up of the two
use cases to address the similarities in a cleaner fashion.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/4013
Change-Id: I5878ddb9f82684d775f9daa66fea434d58f9609c

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-07 07:41:01.000000000', 'files': ['osprofiler/profiler.py', 'osprofiler/tests/test_profiler.py'], 'message': 'Use uuidutils instead of uuid.uuid4()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ia2ad4b3b683b6c432cb8629b5253dae8805af0e7
Closes-Bug: #1082248
'}]
commit_message:
Use uuidutils instead of uuid.uuid4()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: Ia2ad4b3b683b6c432cb8629b5253dae8805af0e7

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-07 13:56:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fake_imagebackend.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Mock imagebackend template funcs in ImageBackendFixture

This represents a small change to how we test the arguments passed to
a template function. Most tests which test cache() currently don't
directly test the callback function. Some test the callback function
which was passed to cache(), but this is undesirable as:

  * It breaks untestably if you replace it with a wrapper
  * You can't test the arguments which were passed to it

To make this easier to test, and because a subsequent change alters
this slightly in ways we want to make obvious, we update
ImageBackendFixture to execute the callback function when cache() is
called. We pre-emptively mock all callback methods so they are not
actually called. Test can assert on these mocks to check that the
intended callback was called, and the arguments used.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ifef488bcc3d8b7bb11aa7ec8255f9a27f57c3291
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Mock imagebackend template funcs in ImageBackendFixture

This represents a small change to how we test the arguments passed to
a template function. Most tests which test cache() currently don't
directly test the callback function. Some test the callback function
which was passed to cache(), but this is undesirable as:

  * It breaks untestably if you replace it with a wrapper
  * You can't test the arguments which were passed to it

To make this easier to test, and because a subsequent change alters
this slightly in ways we want to make obvious, we update
ImageBackendFixture to execute the callback function when cache() is
called. We pre-emptively mock all callback methods so they are not
actually called. Test can assert on these mocks to check that the
intended callback was called, and the arguments used.

Implements: bp/libvirt-imagebackend-refactor
Change-Id: Ifef488bcc3d8b7bb11aa7ec8255f9a27f57c3291

commit_message:
RBD: ensure temporary config gets deleted

This ensures that if a failure occurs with any of the linuxrbd calls,
the temp config file is still removed.

This also gives it a prefix so it is identifiable.

Change-Id: Ief3d907092e77c48a531a6ae78b10c58cc6db56c

https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1546577

- Sync charm helpers if applicable.

- Fix test executable hashbags for virtualenv prep.

- Add Yakkety-Newton Amulet test definitions.

- Prep Xenial-Ocata Amulet test definitions (not yet enabled).

- Add Newton tests.

commit_message:
Fixup concurrent modification

Copy the joined group set before iterating over it and
discard members (just incase the driver isn't discarding)
after leaving future completion (success or failure).

Closes-Bug: #1647942

Change-Id: I43cdb6aeaff53feb6f4a8f53ab4664272bff856f

Change-Id: Ia8643f9c041f91dcb08ab8b6011be7be1fdf0311

commit_message:
functional: don't create flavors if ironic testing

For ironic driver functional testing on gate only a flavor named
"baremetal" is required which is already created by ironic devstack. So,
creation of flavors "m1.small" and "s1.small" should be skipped for
ironic driver functional testing.

Change-Id: Ia8643f9c041f91dcb08ab8b6011be7be1fdf0311

commit_message:
Add a SELinux policy to relabel files in /usr/local/bin as bin_t

There is a default policy for that in Fedora, however it doesn't
work in Atomic since /usr/local is a symlink to /var/usrlocal

Closes-Bug: 1646421
Change-Id: I4c5b836f4f76ff93a2c55f85ff6ff0cbe990bcff

subject: Update OVS handling and test hooks
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-02 15:48:48.000000000', 'files': ['networking_sfc/tests/contrib/post_test_hook.sh', 'networking_sfc/tests/contrib/gate_hook.sh', 'devstack/post_test_hook.sh', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'networking_sfc/tests/contrib/filters.template', 'devstack/lib/ovs', 'networking_sfc/tests/contrib/README'], 'message': 'Update OVS handling and test hooks

* Sync infra scripts with neutron ones
* Use new function to only rebuild OVS if needed in tests (from Neutron)
* Keep system OVS for devstack (2.4.0 does not compile on xenial and CentOS 7)
* Do not source openrc file to prevent devstack "Plugin attempted to be
  enabled twice" errors
* Drop the debug neutron calls that required the openrc source
  (configuration files are already accessible in logs.openstack.org,
  network status should be checked in tests themselves)

Related-Bug: #1641524
Change-Id: I283d8b0a362e77948734a4ef8228721d10d07fde
'}]
commit_message:
Update OVS handling and test hooks

* Sync infra scripts with neutron ones
* Use new function to only rebuild OVS if needed in tests (from Neutron)
* Keep system OVS for devstack (2.4.0 does not compile on xenial and CentOS 7)
* Do not source openrc file to prevent devstack "Plugin attempted to be
  enabled twice" errors
* Drop the debug neutron calls that required the openrc source
  (configuration files are already accessible in logs.openstack.org,
  network status should be checked in tests themselves)

Related-Bug: #1641524
Change-Id: I283d8b0a362e77948734a4ef8228721d10d07fde

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I836b56d125ec781f24b5ea1797ac882b353e2379
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit 9e7ed558f22572f4a99534ff57ab1ccc3eedc787)

commit_message:
Added retries for db_sync

If db sync fails, it is never retried leading to errors. So, this
patch adds retries for db_sync to avoid sync fails.

Change-Id: I1ee9f046284d8720447c02f0fbbbc4448eaaf4d9
Related-Bug: #1628580
Closes-Bug: #1645474
(cherry picked from commit e7db0e93f3edeb6d5857fbd5149a89a9b10f63a2)

contents.

subject: Fix mountpoint detection
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-29 17:16:18.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/common/operating_system.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_volume.py', 'releasenotes/notes/mountpoint-detection-096734f0097eb75a.yaml', 'trove/guestagent/volume.py'], 'message': 'Fix mountpoint detection

During guestagent volume operations the calls to unmount check if the
volume is mounted first. The python function os.path.ismount returns
False if the directory if not readable by the current user, breaking
this functionality for some datastores.

The symptom of this failure is that the device ends up mounted twice
during prepare and then fails to unmount fully during resize.

The fix is to create a custom is_mount function that runs as the root user.

Change-Id: I151402717386230371bafcedc170d70b3588e912
Closes-Bug: #1645773
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mountpoint detection

During guestagent volume operations the calls to unmount check if the
volume is mounted first. The python function os.path.ismount returns
False if the directory if not readable by the current user, breaking
this functionality for some datastores.

The symptom of this failure is that the device ends up mounted twice
during prepare and then fails to unmount fully during resize.

The fix is to create a custom is_mount function that runs as the root user.

Change-Id: I151402717386230371bafcedc170d70b3588e912
Closes-Bug: #1645773

subject: Fix can't process the resource with name 'help'
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-07 02:32:54.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/unit/v2/fakes.py', 'novaclient/shell.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Fix can't process the resource with name 'help'

novaclient can't process the resource if the name is 'help',
like 'nova show help', 'nova flavor-show help', 'nova delete help',
etc. We should encourage user to use 'nova help xxxx' to show
subcommand usage, rather than 'nova xxxx help`.

Change-Id: I65204a908dc2378b6264297ddd87fcb8912a5770
Closes-Bug: #1641048
"}]
commit_message:
Fix can't process the resource with name 'help'

novaclient can't process the resource if the name is 'help',
like 'nova show help', 'nova flavor-show help', 'nova delete help',
etc. We should encourage user to use 'nova help xxxx' to show
subcommand usage, rather than 'nova xxxx help`.

Change-Id: I65204a908dc2378b6264297ddd87fcb8912a5770
Closes-Bug: #1641048

commit_message:
Fix print warning when scheduler starts

Messages about creating new directory or finding already created
directory should not be treated as "WARNING", it's normal behavior.
Also, there is no need to print this messages every execution
of scheduler.

Closes-Bug: #1646851
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Change according to preferred word choice

According to preferred word choice document [1] we should use only
"OpenStack" term in our guides, READme documents and so on.

This patch fix our docs and other files according to these requirements.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/word-choice.html

Change-Id: Iff395ad887f733245da338ec707b862a8ec42d8b

commit_message:
The --file parameter should be changed to required

Executing freezer action-create, job-create or session-create without
--file parameter causes NoneType error. The --file parameter should be
changed to required.

Change-Id: I7dcbe4ff2109d4ca1bac79604c918f79f522daa8
Closes-Bug: #1642126

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids. We should
use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: If6b479ab46346b5f141638a5f0c10130bd0696a7
Closes-Bug: #1082248

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2016-12-07 09:04:20.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/skip-lookup-and-heartbeat-if-apiurl-not-configured-5ae8b04ae1e74673.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/config.py', 'ironic_python_agent/agent.py', 'ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Skip API related work if no api url configured

Currently, if IPA is booted without an ironic api url, it will default
to localhost and fail to connect. Instead, we now explicitly fail and
print a log message if no api callback url is provided.

Change-Id: I0271be94ba7febc6abd5bf3343f6fa179bc1a6a4
Closes-Bug: #1643966
'}]
commit_message:
Skip API related work if no api url configured

Currently, if IPA is booted without an ironic api url, it will default
to localhost and fail to connect. Instead, we now explicitly fail and
print a log message if no api callback url is provided.

Change-Id: I0271be94ba7febc6abd5bf3343f6fa179bc1a6a4
Closes-Bug: #1643966

The Oslo Policy library provides support for RBAC policy
enforcement across all OpenStack services.

Update the devstack plugin to copy the default policy file
over to /etc/trove in the gate environments.

Note: Not adding a rule for 'reset-password' instance
action as that API was discontinued years ago
and is now just waiting for removal (Bug: 1645866).

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Ali Adil <aadil@tesora.com>

Change-Id: Ic443a4c663301840406cad537159eab7b0b5ed1c
Implements: blueprint trove-policy
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for Oslo Policies to Trove

The Oslo Policy library provides support for RBAC policy
enforcement across all OpenStack services.

Update the devstack plugin to copy the default policy file
over to /etc/trove in the gate environments.

Note: Not adding a rule for 'reset-password' instance
action as that API was discontinued years ago
and is now just waiting for removal (Bug: 1645866).

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Ali Adil <aadil@tesora.com>

Change-Id: Ic443a4c663301840406cad537159eab7b0b5ed1c
Implements: blueprint trove-policy

commit_message:
Create common modules for agent codes

This is a starting point to refactor existing storlet agent codes,
which runs inside docker container, and introduces common directory
where we can place common functions between daemon factory and
storlet daemon.

Change-Id: If43af40ad1f972bfaff1f1f02ddc887f5238d2d0

commit_message:
Updated tox.ini to pick up requirements from upper constraints

Openstack infra now supports the upper constraints. So, this patch
updates the tox.ini to pick requirements from openstack/requirements
directly. Also added tox_install.sh script.

Change-Id: I9e24bceda3026943f9815bcb513cde6c70c5e762
Closes-Bug: #1614361

subject: [install] Fix 'host' config param in [api] section
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 13:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/install-guide-from-source.rst', 'install-guide/source/common/configure_2_edit_magnum_conf.rst'], 'message': "[install] Fix 'host' config param in [api] section

Currently 'host' param in [api] section is set to hostname which
is not correct because 'host' under [api] is of type IPOpt.
It should be set to the IP address on which magnum api service
should listen.

Change-Id: I3e9672eaa6425293c5429aceafc9be3f07e0bf45
Closes-Bug: #1647560
"}]
commit_message:
[install] Fix 'host' config param in [api] section

Currently 'host' param in [api] section is set to hostname which
is not correct because 'host' under [api] is of type IPOpt.
It should be set to the IP address on which magnum api service
should listen.

Change-Id: I3e9672eaa6425293c5429aceafc9be3f07e0bf45
Closes-Bug: #1647560

commit_message:
Add bashate checks to pep8 step

Similarly to pep8 checks, this allows enforcing a consistent
style of the shell scripts accross modfications. For now
only the indentation is enforced to reduce code churn.

Closes-Bug: 1648099
Change-Id: Ie66cbe1aea4bd01a8bba8833ef6cbd2cff6a7c6a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-07 05:47:59.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/scalpels.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Switch to xenial: scalpels

This repo has only a master branch, so switch job directly to xenial.
Mark dsvm jobs as -nv, they are both experimental and non-voting.
Add job-suffix really as last part so that our regexes work and change
ostype to node.

Change-Id: I166b285fab53419d2c0e03a118ab0031c9ce719a
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to xenial: scalpels

This repo has only a master branch, so switch job directly to xenial.
Mark dsvm jobs as -nv, they are both experimental and non-voting.
Add job-suffix really as last part so that our regexes work and change
ostype to node.

Change-Id: I166b285fab53419d2c0e03a118ab0031c9ce719a

commit_message:
Update detach_volume() with versionedobjects

The following patch updates detach_volume
API to use volume versionedobjects.  Changes were
made to be backwards compatible with older RPC clients.
It only includes changes to the core cinder code.
Changes in the drivers are left to each driver
maintainer to update.

We want to update both the attach_volume()
and detach_volume() with versionedobjects.
There are 3 patches in the chain.

The patch sequence is:
- Update attach_volume() with versionedojbects
- Update detach_volume() with versionedobjects
- Update test cases related to attach_volume
  and detach_volume in file

subject: Add UI tests for Delete Environment from Details View.
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-12-05 20:55:37.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py', 'muranodashboard/tests/functional/base.py'], 'message': 'Add UI tests for Delete Environment from Details View.

In addition, added two helper functions to base.py:
  1) def wait_for_alert_message_to_disappear which waits for the
     alert message to completely disappear. This is needed
     because the alert message pops up directly above the
     Delete Environment button in the detail view, causing
     the click() function to fail.
  2) def wait_element_is_visible which waits for an element
     to become "present on the DOM of a page and visible"
     (from documentation). This is not absolutely needed,
     but is included as a "just-in-case".

Change-Id: I300f23fc566b40cf3f50a344e98ff94cf17bbf9e
Partial-Bug: #1596196
'}]
commit_message:
Add UI tests for Delete Environment from Details View.

In addition, added two helper functions to base.py:
  1) def wait_for_alert_message_to_disappear which waits for the
     alert message to completely disappear. This is needed
     because the alert message pops up directly above the
     Delete Environment button in the detail view, causing
     the click() function to fail.
  2) def wait_element_is_visible which waits for an element
     to become "present on the DOM of a page and visible"
     (from documentation). This is not absolutely needed,
     but is included as a "just-in-case".

Change-Id: I300f23fc566b40cf3f50a344e98ff94cf17bbf9e
Partial-Bug: #1596196

subject: Increase subuid/subgid range for root user
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-07 15:24:56.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_lxd_utils.py', 'hooks/lxd_utils.py'], 'message': "Increase subuid/subgid range for root user

To support use of distinct subuid/subgid ranges per LXD container,
the default range for the root user must be increased to support
> 1 running container in this configuration.

Increase subuid/subgid range to support 5000 containers with distinct
ranges.  Restart LXD daemon if idmap configuration changes, to ensure
that the full range of subid's are used.

Change-Id: I8b87dad736abaffdbd7afac090429790d3b03c96
Closes-Bug: 1648056
"}]
commit_message:
Increase subuid/subgid range for root user

To support use of distinct subuid/subgid ranges per LXD container,
the default range for the root user must be increased to support
> 1 running container in this configuration.

Increase subuid/subgid range to support 5000 containers with distinct
ranges.  Restart LXD daemon if idmap configuration changes, to ensure
that the full range of subid's are used.

Change-Id: I8b87dad736abaffdbd7afac090429790d3b03c96
Closes-Bug: 1648056

commit_message:
[doc|install_guide] Fix 'host' config param in [api] section

Currently 'host' param in [api] section is set to hostname which
is not correct because 'host' under [api] is of type IPOpt.
It should be set to the IP address on which magnum api service
should listen.

Change-Id: I3e9672eaa6425293c5429aceafc9be3f07e0bf45
Closes-Bug: #1647560

* All "qemu-img convert" calls now specify the import format so that it
  does not have to be inferred by qemu-img.

SecurityImpact

Co-authored-by: Hemanth Makkapati <hemanth.makkapati@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1449062

Change-Id: I65f30b85439a8811545b0ca590555528631954df
'}]
commit_message:
Adding constraints around qemu-img calls

* All "qemu-img info" calls are now run under resource limitations that
  limit CPU time to 2 seconds and address space usage to 1 GB. This
  helps avoid any DoS attacks via malicious images.
* All "qemu-img convert" calls now specify the import format so that it
  does not have to be inferred by qemu-img.

SecurityImpact

(Hemanth did all the work on this, I'm just doing the backport.)

Co-authored-by: Hemanth Makkapati <hemanth.makkapati@rackspace.com>
Closes-Bug: #1449062
(cherry picked from commit 69a9b659fd48aa3c1f84fc7bc9ae236b6803d31f)

Change-Id: I65f30b85439a8811545b0ca590555528631954df

through use of the stevedore library. This requires changing the

commit_message:
Use stevedore for console driver

Avoid having to configure the full class path of the console driver
through use of the stevedore library. This requires changing the
'console.driver' configuration option to use entrypoints, defined in
'setup.cfg', instead of the class paths previously defined.

Logic is included to retain backwards compatibility with class
path-style definitions, which can be removed in a future change.

Change-Id: Ie83ba07165fc3aa4274e57c6c10c959c9ac51538

commit_message:
Separate common fields from TemplateFields

blueprint static-datasource-config-format will reuse the syntax
of scenario template but only the topology related fields. Having
a common fields definition will keep the terminology consistent.

- used in topology definition: `TopologyFields`
- used in scenario template: `TemplateFields`

commit_message:
improve ceilometer-polling-agent transport sample method

From liberty, ceilometer-compute-agent only support notify method to transport
sample to ceilometer-notification. It will increase stress upon message queue
when ceilometer-compute-agent transport a lot of samples. On other hand,
ceilometer-compute-agent directly transport samples to collector-agent,
it will decrease time to process and store sample.

Change-Id: Idd2480508f8a4eb548579a03761ff26ec2ed049c
Closes-bug: #1608417

subject: Use __slots__ for dependencies.Node
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 20:55:02.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/dependencies.py'], 'message': 'Use __slots__ for dependencies.Node

The number of nodes in the dependency graph is not huge (one per resource),
but we tend to make a lot of copies - the whole graph must be copied every
time we iterate through it. Since the Node class has only two attributes
and is basically never modified, we can easily save a little memory by
defining __slots__ for it.

Change-Id: Ibe36016a5889c9f1bd89672b1b03b2bc69b7925b
'}]
commit_message:
Use __slots__ for dependencies.Node

The number of nodes in the dependency graph is not huge (one per resource),
but we tend to make a lot of copies - the whole graph must be copied every
time we iterate through it. Since the Node class has only two attributes
and is basically never modified, we can easily save a little memory by
defining __slots__ for it.

Change-Id: Ibe36016a5889c9f1bd89672b1b03b2bc69b7925b

subject: Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-25 04:14:29.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used
to keep codes from oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator.
Removing openstack/commonfrom all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release. So
don't use this directory any more. We should drop it for improving
searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Ia154f7557575351173b9fe646e48bc5210ab698f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

There is no this directory openstack/common which was used
to keep codes from oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator.
Removing openstack/commonfrom all OpenStack code in favor of the
Oslo libraries is a project wide goal for the Ocata release. So
don't use this directory any more. We should drop it for improving
searching efficiency.

Change-Id: Ia154f7557575351173b9fe646e48bc5210ab698f

subject: Modify variable's usage in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-06 09:13:19.000000000', 'files': ['murano/cmd/test_runner.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's usage in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: If8d36220a9370b304ae51a329f8bba370285fdc2
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's usage in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging code,
rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#log-translation
For example:
# WRONG
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
# RIGHT
LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: If8d36220a9370b304ae51a329f8bba370285fdc2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-07 12:19:00.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Added constraints for 'hacking' lib for pep8

We have upper constraints for hacking lib in test-requirements.txt.
Now they are:

But we didn't use these constraints for pep8. For pep8 we only
'hacking' dependency in tox.ini without any constraints.

Change-Id: Id0fbbaa46440f0e553c5cad73110325be3d0bfa1
"}]
commit_message:
Added constraints for 'hacking' lib for pep8

We have upper constraints for hacking lib in test-requirements.txt.
Now they are:
  hacking<0.11,>=0.10.0

But we didn't use these constraints for pep8. For pep8 we only
'hacking' dependency in tox.ini without any constraints.

Because of it we install the latest version of 'hacking' each time.

More information in bug description.

Closes-Bug: #1648054

Change-Id: Id0fbbaa46440f0e553c5cad73110325be3d0bfa1

subject: Use ``Range`` header in HTTP requests for partial downloads.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 8158, 'name': 'Hemanth Makkapati', 'email': 'makstacker+osgerrit@gmail.com', 'username': 'hemanth.makkapati'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 21722, 'name': 'Dharini Chandrasekar', 'email': 'dharini.chandrasekar@intel.com', 'username': 'dharinic'}, {'_account_id': 22448, 'name': 'Alexander Bashmakov', 'email': 'abashmak@yahoo.com', 'username': 'abashmak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-11-25 14:27:03.000000000', 'files': ['specs/ocata/approved/glance/lite-specs.rst'], 'message': 'Use ``Range`` header in HTTP requests for partial downloads.

Currently, when a partial download request is sent, the
``Content-Range`` is parsed in glance/common/wsgi.py to
obtain the byte range. What this means is that the user
is expected to specify the byte range he/she intends to
download in a format of a HTTP range response.
For example: A user has to give "bytes 12-30/32" instead
of "bytes=12-32".
W3 standards (RFC 7233) specify ``Content-Range`` to be sent
as a response for a ``Range`` header in a HTTP request.
(https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7233#section-4.2)

This lite-spec suggests the acceptance of ``Range`` headers
for partial download requests.

Change-Id: I5bdadde682a0c50836bd95e2a6651d6e7e18f172
'}]
commit_message:
Use ``Range`` header in HTTP requests for partial downloads.

Currently, when a partial download request is sent, the
``Content-Range`` is parsed in glance/common/wsgi.py to
obtain the byte range. What this means is that the user
is expected to specify the byte range he/she intends to
download in a format of a HTTP range response.
For example: A user has to give "bytes 12-30/32" instead
of "bytes=12-32".
W3 standards (RFC 7233) specify ``Content-Range`` to be sent
as a response for a ``Range`` header in a HTTP request.
(https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7233#section-4.2)

This lite-spec suggests the acceptance of ``Range`` headers
for partial download requests.

Change-Id: I5bdadde682a0c50836bd95e2a6651d6e7e18f172

action + "_" + resource(single object)

action + "_all_" + resources(multi objects)

action:create/update/delete/get

resource:
lswitch/lport/lrouter/security_group/floatingip...

Change-Id: I95f65c425d30fdc1d4091631d04d1a8e49ba160b
Partial-bug: #1636888

subject: Allow to choose which Glance API to enable
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}, {'_account_id': 18795, 'name': 'mkarpin', 'email': 'mkarpin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nkarpin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 15:51:37.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/api_versions-b2a58d83f4291b3c.yaml', 'manifests/registry.pp', 'manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/glance_api_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/glance_registry_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Allow to choose which Glance API to enable

- Allow to configure Glance API v1 with enable_v1_api boolean.
  If set to True, the glance::registry::enable_v1_registry also needs to
  be set to True. Note that if you set these values to True, Glance will
  send some deprecation warnings.
  This option is separated from enable_v2_api, and both API versions can be
  deployed together.

- Allow to configure Glance API v2 with enable_v2_api boolean.
  This option is separated from enable_v1_api, and both API versions can be
  deployed together.

Change-Id: Ibbb8b970971c899ae94097042465f605fe55f748
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to choose which Glance API to enable

- Allow to configure Glance API v1 with enable_v1_api boolean.
  If set to True, the glance::registry::enable_v1_registry also needs to
  be set to True. Note that if you set these values to True, Glance will
  send some deprecation warnings.
  This option is separated from enable_v2_api, and both API versions can be
  deployed together.

- Allow to configure Glance API v2 with enable_v2_api boolean.
  This option is separated from enable_v1_api, and both API versions can be
  deployed together.

Change-Id: Ibbb8b970971c899ae94097042465f605fe55f748

Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 10881, 'name': 'Neill Cox', 'email': 'neill@ingenious.com.au', 'username': 'neillc'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 14806, 'name': 'Chhavi Agarwal', 'email': 'chhagarw@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'chhagarw'}, {'_account_id': 22111, 'name': 'Ravi Gummadi', 'email': 'ravigumm@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'ravigumm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-05 15:27:09.000000000', 'files': ['templates/my.cnf.j2', 'templates/mysql_defaults.j2', 'templates/systemd.limits.conf.j2'], 'message': "Fix galera max connections calculation

The max connection calculation uses the number of vcpus reported by ansible
however it's using the wrong value in one portion of the calculation. The
result is that the calculation returns 0 rather than the intended 200 when
there are both x86 and POWER controllers.

Change-Id: I48314a3b701da4df6aaa0c163b14da36a1e70b7f
Closes-Bug: #1647106
"}]
commit_message:
Fix galera max connections calculation

The max connection calculation uses the number of vcpus reported by ansible
however it's using the wrong value in one portion of the calculation. The
result is that the calculation returns 0 rather than the intended 200 when
there are both x86 and POWER controllers.

Change-Id: I48314a3b701da4df6aaa0c163b14da36a1e70b7f
Closes-Bug: #1647106

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 08:37:31.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_profiles.py'], 'message': "Fix profile create - call subclass methods

This patch ensures the profile_create API invokes the appropriate class
methods if a subclass of Profile has overridden the 'create' method.

Change-Id: Ic8ca03ab2fab2e3237c338e3f5d9bcec2629fa0a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix profile create - call subclass methods

This patch ensures the profile_create API invokes the appropriate class
methods if a subclass of Profile has overridden the 'create' method.

Change-Id: Ic8ca03ab2fab2e3237c338e3f5d9bcec2629fa0a
